title: Hallucinatory monster
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination") can cause you to perceive [monsters](/wiki/Monsters "Monsters") as other beings, including those that otherwise do not exist in the game. These **hallucinatory monsters** are based on creatures from other [roguelikes](/wiki/Roguelike "Roguelike"), fantasy worlds, folklores and popular culture.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Some of the creatures used as hallucinatory monsters may appear as real monsters in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and other variants of *NetHack*.

[ ]

html:
Hallucinatory monster

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, hallucination can cause you to perceive monsters as other beings, including those that otherwise do not exist in the game. These hallucinatory monsters are based on creatures from other roguelikes, fantasy worlds, folklores and popular culture.[1]

Some of the creatures used as hallucinatory monsters may appear as real monsters in SLASH'EM and other variants of NetHack.

rawPage:
In ''[[NetHack]]'', [[hallucination]] can cause you to perceive [[monsters]] as other beings, including those that otherwise do not exist in the game. These '''hallucinatory monsters''' are based on creatures from other [[roguelike]]s, fantasy worlds, folklores and popular culture.{{refsrc|dat/bogusmon.txt|1|nethack=3.6.0}}

Some of the creatures used as hallucinatory monsters may appear as real monsters in [[SLASH'EM]] and other variants of ''NetHack''.

==List of hallucinatory monsters==
===Games===
====Quendor (''[[Wikipedia:Zork|Zork]]'', etc.)====
*[[Wikipedia:Grue (monster)|grue]]
*[[Wikipedia:Christmas tree|Christmas-tree]] monster
*[[luck]] sucker
*paskald

*dornbeast
